channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Virginia is for…data centers? Residents are increasingly saying 'No'
item.description: The world's highest concentration of data centers is in Virginia. Residents are not happy about that.

item.title: Lesotho declares state of disaster after massive tariff threats from U.S.
item.description: Lesotho, a tiny mountain kingdom in Southern Africa, has just declared a two-year state of disaster after being threatened with the highest U.S. tariffs in the world.

item.title: Senate debates package that would cut foreign aid and public media funding
item.description: The Senate debates the clawing back of previously approved funding for foreign aid and public media — as Democratic lawmakers object. A final vote in the Senate is expected by Thursday.

item.title: The air Israeli strikes on the capital marked a sharp escalation
item.description: Israel bombed the Syrian capital Damascus on Wednesday, saying it targeted the Syrian military headquarters and the area near the presidential palace to protect the Druze religious minority in Syria.

item.title: The U.K. government secretly relocated thousands of Afghans to Britain for two years
item.description: The British government hid a billion dollar plan to rescue Afghans who assisted its troops after a data leak compromised exposed them to Taliban retaliation.

item.title: Meet the oldest runner to complete the Badwater Ultramarathon
item.description: Eighty-year-old Bob Becker became the oldest person ever to complete the grueling Badwater 135 ultramarathon, starting in Death Valley's sweltering heat and covering three mountain ranges.

item.title: Mayo Clinic medical residents' training includes improv classes to improve patient relationships
item.description: Improv comedy classes are part of the training medical residents at Minnesota's Mayo Clinic receive. It's an effort to help doctors learn early how to improve relationships with patients.

item.title: 5 air traffic controllers explain the improvements they want
item.description: Former and current U.S. air traffic controllers say Trump administration's plan to overhaul the nation's air traffic system does little to fix the bigger problem: a nationwide staffing shortage.

item.title: What's it like to have Frank Lloyd Wright design your house? This 101-year-old knows
item.description: Tucked into the woods of Pleasantville, N.Y., lies Usonia — a cooperative community created in part by famed architect Frank Lloyd Wright. One resident is 101 years old.

item.title: Nebraska keeps ban on food assistance for those with drug convictions
item.description: Under a legacy of the war on drugs, some states still ban people with drug convictions from getting government food assistance. Nebraska lawmakers tried to do away with their ban and just fell short.
